awd_titl_txt: Conference Support: 2019 Workshop on Quasiperiodicity and Fractality in Quantum Statistical Physics - May 20-23, 2019 at Rutgers University
awd_abstract_narration:
This award provides travel support for students and postdoctoral scholars to participate in the 2019 workshop on Quasiperiodicity and Fractality in Quantum Statistical Physics. This workshop is to be held from May 20 to May 23, 2019 at the Rutgers University Inn and Conference Center in New Brunswick, New Jersey. 

The conference program includes many of the research topics that are important for condensed matter physics, quantum information science, and atomic, molecular, and optical physics.  The meeting offers an opportunity for students and postdoctoral scholars to present their research results and to interact with senior scientists primarily from the United States, but also the broader international community. Support is provided only for students enrolled at U.S. institutions and for postdoctoral researchers affiliated with U.S. institutions."

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The first workshop on Quasiperiodicity and Fractality in Quantum Statistical Physics took place in New Brunsick, NJ on 20-23 May, 2019. The workshop brought together an interdisciplinary cohort of researchers from photonics, condensed matter physics, and atomic, molecular, and optical (AMO) physics, along with mathematicians and statistical mechanics. A key component of the workshop was the inclusion and active integration of younger researchers -- undergraduate and graduate students and early-career postdoctoral researchers, who engaged with the broader conference audience through discussions and several organized poster sessions. Further information on the workshop, including outreach events, can be found at the workshop website: https://sites.google.com/view/quasiperiodicfractality2019/home

The key outcome of this student support grant was the direct travel support of 16 young researchers (undergraduates, graduates, and postdocs - with a specific emphasis on supporting researchers from underrepresented groups), which enabled their attendance at the workshop. This, in turn, enabled the professional development and training of a sizable cohort in a key problem area related to thermalization and localization in quantum systems. This workshop likely led to the initialization of collaborations amongst the attendees, with several demonstrated outcomes from scientific ideas that were generated at the workshop. More broadly, it provided an opportunity for students and postdocs to attend a high-profile topic meeting, present their results at poster sessions, and to engage directly with more senior scientists at the event.


Last Modified: 08/29/2021
Modified by: Bryce Gadway
